name: onsucssi

stmt.origin: mp2an(wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1)), wcel(c0, con0), word(c1))
stmt.pretty: mp2an((c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1), c0 ∈ On, Ord(c1))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1))
-| wcel(c0, con0)
-| word(c1)
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1)
⊣ c0 ∈ On
⊣ Ord(c1)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ On ∧ Ord(c1))→(c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1))
-| wcel(c0, con0)
-| word(c1)
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1)
⊣ c0 ∈ On
⊣ Ord(c1)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ On ∧ Ord(c1))→(c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1))
-| wcel(c0, con0)
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1)))
-| wcel(c1, con0)

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wss(csuc(c0), c1))
-| wcel(c0, con0)
-| wcel(c1, con0)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 ↔ suc(c0)⊆ c1)
⊣ c0 ∈ On
⊣ c1 ∈ On

comment: A set belongs to an ordinal number iff its successor is a subset of the ordinal number. Exercise 8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 42 and its converse. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-1995.)
